page.title: 14 Game keepers
page.content: About fourteen gamekeepers were employed on the estate each being in charge of approximately 800 acres of land and responsible for 50 coops.The pheasants eggs were hatched under a brooding hen and the chicks when reared were released on to the estate In the quiter period of the year the task of the game keeper was to protect the pheasants from vermin such as owls,weazels,stoats and foxes.As the darker nights approached,so the number of poachers increased, then the game keepers rounds would become much busier .Shooting time for the pheasants began in October.Some of the birds taken would be used at Castle Ashby house and some were sold in Northampton, but most were sent to the game dealers in London .Beaters had to be taken on during the pheasant shoot
